Key Arguments: The legislation represents government control over free speech and poses a threat to democracy.
Governments worldwide struggle to identify misinformation and often suppress dissent instead of championing free speech.
Allowing the government to be the final judge of truth is dangerous and reminiscent of totalitarianism.
The bill is biased and silences the average citizen while allowing certain groups to speak out.
The vagueness of the bill leads to self-censorship and is a tactic used by authoritarian regimes.
Satire and humor, important tools for commentary, are at risk under this legislation.
The real danger is not misinformation but the growing distrust between the government and its citizens.
Notable Quotes: Freedom is never more than one generation away from extinction... It must be fought for, protected, and handed on.
Letting the government be the final judge of truth is chilling.
The real danger isn't misinformation, but the widening gap between the rulers and the ruled.
